text: <@U05R380MLMC> I just wanted to say thank you for your advice here on a Friday evening! And no, the workflow editor doesn’t seem to give me access to the response data once the invoice was created (this is exactly what I was hoping it would do). And, turns out, one of my clients signed up for a free trial of Ops Hub Pro, hence my ability to fire a webhook. Sigh…

I'm determined to find a path forward.

You don't really need invoices to be created the moment a quote is sent and/or signed.

What if you had an external service checking for signed quotes and handling the invoice creation?

Well, the invoice _creation_ isn’t the issue. It’s being able to pull the invoice number that was created so that I can locate and update the QBO invoice. The purpose is to edit the invoice so that it reflects 50% due of the invoice total. From my understanding, HubSpot doesn’t support deposits on Quotes.
Using the native Quickbooks integration in HubSpot is creating the issue, right?
It's not flexible enough for your use case

Yes, using the QBO native integration to create the invoice and pull the invoice number. If I had the invoice number included in a POST, I could upgrade their account to Ops Pro and fire a webhook to Zapier. I can do all the updates in QBO there.

Exactly what I was concluding about the native integration! That’s often how native integrations go.
I find it sort of crazy that HubSpot quotes don’t support a 50% deposit use case. That’s so common among my clients, and a reason for me to ditch HubSpot Quotes and go to something like PandaDoc.
Yeah - that's a bummer.  Ops Pro really enables you to build whatever you want.  Going the PandaDoc route is cheaper though.

The workaround, if they don’t want to pay to have everything fully automated, is for the initial invoice (with 100% of the total reflected) drafted w/ the HubSpot QBO integration. and then they’d simply open up the invoice and update it before sending it out.

But darn, I want the whole thing to be easily automated, lol. :slightly_smiling_face:
Yeah - I think there are options but requires use of external tools along with development.
